Event.name: Commerce_scenario
Event.definition:
<def-root>Commerce is a situation in which a <fen>Buyer</fen> and a <fen>Seller</fen> have agreed upon an exchange of <fen>Money</fen> and <fen>Goods</fen> (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change.
The <fen>Seller</fen> indicates their willingness to give the <fen>Goods</fen> in their possession to a <fen>Buyer</fen> who would give them some amount of <fen>Money</fen>. The <fen>Seller</fen> may have already decided on the amount of money that they would require, in which case it is called the Asking price.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> also indicates their willingness to give an amount of money called an Offer to a <fen>Seller</fen> who would give them the <fen>Goods</fen>.
Normally the process is begun by the <fen>Seller</fen>. The means by which the <fen>Seller</fen> indicates their wish to engage in an exchange are various, ranging from putting a price tag on an item on a store shelf, to advertizing, to communicating directly and specifically with a possible <fen>Buyer</fen>. In some cases, however, the process may be initiated by the <fen>Buyer</fen> indicating to a possible <fen>Seller</fen> that they would like to make an exchange.
<ex><t>buyer</t> beware.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Buyer
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>She was considered a <t><fex name="Byr">purchaser</fex></t> of the finest things</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Seller
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>. <ex><fex name="Slr">My local grocery store</fex> raised <t>prices</t> on meat</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Money
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction. <ex>The <t>price</t> of the sweater <m>was</m> <fex name="Mny"> $50</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Goods
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex>She was considered a <t>purchaser</t> <fex name="Gds">of the finest things</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Rate
Arg.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. <ex> The authorities cut tomato <t>prices</t> <fex name="Rate"> to a dollar per pound</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Unit
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>The <t>price</t> of Bob's peppers is determined <fex name="Unit">by the pound</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. <ex>It is efficient to engage in <t>commerce</t> <fex name="Mns">by ship</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the agent intends to bring about as a result of participating in the Commercial Transaction.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: price.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

lexUnit.name: commerce.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the activity of buying and selling, especially on a large scale

lexUnit.name: trafficker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who deals in the commerce of illegal goods (esp. drugs).

lexUnit.name: supply side.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a generic set of sellers involved in transactions

lexUnit.name: merchandise.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the inventory of the seller.
